page.title: 06The Village of Trewoon
page.content: I live in Trewoon which is a village about a mile from St Austell on the A3058 road which goes to Newquay.This means that it is a busy road especially in the summer when people are down here on holiday.In Trewoon we have most things that we need,a garage,dairy,electrical shop,a post office,a grocery store,a hair dressers and a fish and chip shop.There is a chapel ,a social club, a park with a village hall.We are close to the railway line which goes across the main road on a bridge.The children can catch a bus to St.Mewan school and Penrice school.We have a greengrocer's van which comes on Wednesdays and Saturdays and also a fish van and a bakers van. Trewoon is a nice friendly place to live and not far from St. Austell and also near to the sea. (Jeremy Blythe)
